message: In Gnome with cntrl+alt+shift you move to a space, moving the window with you. Is that doable in OSX?
I didn’t find a way to do this without using the mouse. There is a way do to this with a mouse and a keyboard shortcut: http://hints.macworld.com/article.php?story=20071027122153453
Mouse click n hold + kb shortcut is the only way to do this that's not entirely mouse based (like drag and drop in Spaces overview)
@MikeT well that works.. but its a pain! I hate to use the mouse! jeje
I personally am an enthusiast user of sizeup: http://irradiatedsoftware.com/sizeup/ It turns OSX into a "almost" tiling window manager.
lets see that. I use divvy for that
@durdn is almost like divvy, but divvy has an interesting menu and some good configuration
ShiftIt is like sizeup. But you have to compile it yourself. Chose it over paying for Divvy.
Which is better sizeup or divvy?
